updates.update_userinfo: Dev Blog #6
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! I hope you’re all doing well and the sun is shining wherever you might be.

For this update we’re going to be taking a look at some of the cutscenes in Sunshine Manor.

Since these cutscenes might contain minor spoilers for the story, we did want to warn you before you end up scrolling down.

updates.update_userinfo: Dev Blog #5
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! Has it really been a month already?

Development work for Sunshine Manor is in full force at the moment, and right now, we're adding in some absolutely off-the-wall elements for one of the Demon Realms that we think is going to really tax your brainboxes. It's going to be fun, and we can't wait for you to see the new stuff!

But … GOOD NEWS EVERYBODY (did you read that in Farnsworth's voice?), you've unlocked a chiptune bonus soundtrack thanks to the additional pre-orders we have generated through !

updates.update_userinfo: Dev Blog #4
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! Over the last month we’ve been focused on fine tuning the established gameplay mechanics of Sunshine Manor and making Ada even more responsive. Sure, it might sound cool but, in reality, is utterly boring coding and bug fixing, so we thought we’d do something a bit special for this update… how about we see the special cover?
Rather than read our mumblings and ramblings, we’ll let Graham describe the process and thinking behind the cover himself:

updates.update_userinfo: Dev Blog #3
updates.update_content: Hello everyone, we hope this update finds you all well! It’s Valentine’s DAy weekend, and since we’re currently hard at work polishing the second mission in Sunshine Manor, we wanted to start the celebrations with a sneak peek at what we have in store for you!

updates.update_userinfo: Dev Blog #2
updates.update_content:
Happy New Year everyone! We all hope you were able to have some festivities wherever you are in a safe way.
Over Christmas and New Year, we did put our tools down for a short period of time so that we could reboot and be ready to give it our all in 2021, so this update is going to focus on one thing … the artwork by Graham Humphreys!
We’re not going to show the whole thing just yet, so here are some sneaky peeks!

updates.update_userinfo: Dev Blog #1
updates.update_content:
Has it really been a month already?
First off, before we show off some of the cool new stuff we’ve been working on, we wanted to once again say a huge thank you to every single backer for helping us to make the full-time development of Sunshine Manor a reality. We can’t wait for you to play everything we have planned … and we have lots to show you about the game over the next year!
Rather than go into a hugely detailed analysis of the new missions, enemies, and systems within Sunshine Manor, we thought a screenshots would be way more fun!

updates.update_userinfo: The Kickstarter Is Now Over!
updates.update_content:
What a ride it has been! After a month-long Kickstarter (and months of work before that!) the campaign for Sunshine Manor is now over! We can finally stop refreshing our browsers every 30 seconds!
We want to thank each and every one of you for your support, because without you, we wouldn’t have a Kickstarter that has not only reached its main funding goal, but also several Stretch Goals!

updates.update_userinfo: Turn Up The Volume!
updates.update_content:
Who's ready for some music? It seems all of you are, since you've managed to unlock another Stretch Goal that will add 2 extra songs to the Sunshine Manor soundtrack!
And since music is a big part of the experience, why not spice things up a bit?

updates.update_userinfo: It's The Final 24 Hours!
updates.update_content: It's been a great journey, and now the final 24 hours for Sunshine Manor are in full swing!  You've not only helped us reach the main funding goal for the project, you've also unlocked Stretch Goals that added two extra songs to the soundtrack, a playable Gnarlie, an extra costume and power for Ada, a free limited edition enamel pin of Ada for all backers pledging at the "It's Alive! It's Alive!" and higher reward tiers, and are currently working towards unlocking two more songs for the synthwave soundtrack for Sunshine Manor!

Press Kit | Twitter | Facebook | Website | Youtube 


With your love and support, we got 90% of our campaign goal! Among many ideas for stretch goals, we picked out the ones to give you the most value! Here you go!



How to apply add-ons
- After you choose a pledge, press the "Manage your pledge" button above.
- Increase your pledge in "Pledge Amount" by the total of the add-ons you want to add.
- Once the campaign end, you will receive a survey that ask you what add-ons you want.
- You will get the add-ons that you added in addition to all rewards from your base pledge.

Notes for add-ons
- Upgrading keys are targeting Switch, PS5 and XSX/XSS. But these can be changed by our dev. environment in future.
- All physical goodies are same as those from Collectors tier.
- All physical add-on prices include shipping. Never worry for the shipping.



Chrono Sword is a pixel art action-adventure game with an incredible atmosphere, deep combat, and an epic story. You will be Aenor - a time traveler and will travel the past and the present of the fallen world.

The world, all the characters, and effects are painted as gorgeous pixel art with dynamic lighting. Every character animations are so fluid in every direction. And the orchestral soundtracks let you immersive into the play.

The combat is based on attack, dodge, and shield like Dark Souls, is solid and intense. Meanwhile, it is also interactive with enemies and environment like The Last of Us, so you can fight like a skillful expert without memorizing a long skill list.

You will be Aenor and will travel the past and the present of the fallen world. Your journey will be with charming colleagues, and your choice will make the change of story.

We hope to release Chrono Sword not only on Steam but also on all major consoles : Switch, Playstation and Xbox, so that more players can play it. We have licenses for them, and experienced in launching games on them. Chrono Sword already tested on them.
Playtime of Chrono Sword will be about 20~30 hours for common players, at least 10 hours for expert souls-like gamers. There are 16 locations that you can travel in the past and also in the present. 17 epic boss battles are waiting for your challenge.
The estimated release date is November 2021 and the price will be USD 24.99 .
Click here to play the demo !


You have various actions with just 3 main buttons :
- You can make your own combo by a combination of normal and strong attacks
- You can dodge enemy's attack by quickstep, rolling or running away
- You can use your shield to block enemy's attack or to parry it
There is no limit of stamina, you don't need to glancing at the gauge UI during combat anymore.

Your action will vary by interacting surroundings and situations :
- With low health, you walk stumbling bleeding leaning on the wall
- With enemy in front of wall, you can push him to stun
- After a finishing attack, you can kick him to stun others
You don't need complex combinations of command but only a press the interaction button for these.

Prepare for the threatening enemies. They react on your action and surroundings : If you choose to stand holding your shield forever, they try disarm it. There are elite enemies more stronger and skilled, and epic bosses.

The world is non-linear and seamless without loading. You can explore everywhere :
- The sewer under the street you are walking
- The riverside way under the bridge you crossed
- The main hall under the broken rail on the corridor
And besides, you can travel the past and the present of each place. Use your imagination to find secrets and challenges.

Your exploration will be rewarded by new weapons, runes, relics, and collectibles, and they lead your character to grow up.

Weapons, shields &, sub-weapons :
Complete your combat style with new weapons. Search for swords, axes, hammers, spears and shields. You can also use ranged weapons : bows, crossbows, and wands - but better use them strategically, they are not unlimited.

Runes :
Find your own combination of runes. You can acquire various runes and stone plates for them. You can change your play and balance by put the runes on the plate. Each rune has a different effect, size and shape.

Collectibles :
Find various collectibles to be stronger. Unlock new skill with relics. Forge your weapon stronger with ores. Increase your health with Bloodstones. Get your Glyph of Heal more effective with bless. 


During a mission, Aenor meets the young Glendyn by accident, it changes everything. In the changed future, Aenor faces a whole different world that her precious people are all gone. Now, you will be Aenor, will travel the past and the present of the fallen world to claim your mentor back.

 Aenor:
Nyr (Human). Female. 20 years old. A Time Traveler.
Aenor is repeating a time travel mission from the present (12 years after That Night) to the past (12 hours after That Night). As an orphan, she was found by Glendyn at the age of 8 and raised and trained by him. She is an outstanding warrior. As a Time Traveler, she was trained to stay out of past people, so she could be looks cold and calm, but her natures inside are playful, warm, and emotional.

 Glendyn:
Nyr. Male. 26 years old unemployed in the past. 38 years old Time Traveler in the present.
The details are his secrets. He found the young Aenor, then raised and trained her. He is active, bright, and nosy. He talks a lot and is a good speaker. He causes problems as he is nosy, but he is not hated because of his good nature and personality.










Hello, we are "21th Century Ducks". After 10 years in the industry, David and Ellie started this studio in 2015 and released Timing Hero and Super Pixel Racers. We are experienced and skilled, we put the fun and productivity first. We make our best games to give inspiration to players :)

Chrono Sword is a very epic game, and we have many literary, artistic, musical, and technical challenges for this work. Our goal is to complete Chrono Sword as the best game and deliver it to gamers. This requires the attention, feedback, and support of many people, and of course financial stability. We're doing a lot inside the studio, but in order to bring the game into a higher quality, we need many help like translation, cut-scene animations, voice-over, and sound effects. We hope to meet many fans who can support and give feedback, supporters who can help our development, and relationships that we haven't thought of through Kickstarter.



- Once you choose a physical pledge, it will be based on "Avatar tier" not "Aenor tier".
- Once you choose a pledge with physical OST, you will get CD and plus LP.
Since Kickstarter does not allow to edit the pledges after live, you may find different description between this page and the pledge list. You will get better one among them in that case. Sorry for giving you confusing.

(These are just sample to help you. Design can be improved with your opinion !)

T-Shirts :

Poster :

Art Book :

Rare Set :

Unique Statue :
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are working with our private partner and investor "Global Top Round", to "help us with fundraising, publishing and business support". With their help we can make sure that the studio will be sustainable and launch the project at it's absolute peak. On top of this with their second service "gameround.co" we'll be able to directly test and get feedback from thousands of gamers ensuring that we are developing the project to the right factor. This significantly minimizes all risks with our company, giving us an edge over other game development companies. 

We believe that games can inspire and touch gamers, developers and others. To this end, we are making our best games, including many literary, artistic, musical and technical challenges. These challenges require new solutions, a lot of trial and error. A lot of time has been spent on improving game engines and development environments for this, not developing content. In addition, countless synopsis improvements were needed for a high-quality game experience.

For this reason, we couldn't release new contents and news, and communication with fans has decreased. Today, these R&Ds are almost over, and synopsis and scripts are completed, we are moving on to production.

Another risk is how long it will take to bring the experience of new content to the level we want, but we believe that we can solve it through a lot of development experience, and communication with you guys.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Press Kit | Discord | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram | Website | Wishlist on Steam 
Hi everyone, we are Stray Fawn Studio, creators of Niche - a genetics survival game and Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor. Both of our previous games were successfully developed and released with the help of Kickstarter backers like you, and we couldn’t be more excited to tell you about our new project: The Wandering Village!

The Wandering Village is a city building simulation game. In a world where mysterious plants are spreading all over the earth, emitting toxic spores as they grow, a group of people seeks shelter on the back of a giant, wandering creature they call ‘Onbu’.
Become their leader, build their settlement and form a symbiotic relationship with the creature to survive together in this hostile, yet beautiful post-apocalyptic world that now surrounds you.
Key Features
Build a village on the back of a giant creature
Farm various crops
Send out foraging missions to gather rare resources
Survive a variety of different biomes and events
Build a relationship with a giant and influence its actions
Ecology/Biology inspired gameplay
Unique blend of 3D and hand-drawn, hand-animated 2D graphics    

At its core, The Wandering Village is a city building and resource management game with rogue-like and survival elements. Farm various crops to keep your villagers fed, send out foraging missions to gather rare resources and scout the environment while constantly expanding the settlement. Of course, living on the back of a living, breathing beast comes with its own challenges, such as helping to maintain the creature’s health and building trust. This might even lead to the beast paying attention to your requests as it wanders through a variety of different biomes, each with its own perks and challenges, always trying to outrun the threat of the toxic spores.
In-game Screenshot
The ultimate goal, for both the humans and the creature, is to find a place where they can settle down and live in peace again. And if they don’t find this place, maybe they can figure out a way to fight back the plants and create it themselves.

Core Mechanics
Survival - Escape from the toxic spores and keep your villagers and the creature alive against ever-changing threats.
Symbiosis - Live both from and in harmony with the giant creature and form a relationship with it as you trek together through the post-apocalyptic world.
Building - Build an infrastructure where your people can live together, work together and survive together.
Farming - Plant, cultivate and harvest various crops to keep your villagers and the creature fed and healthy, or grow new kinds of resources.
Foraging - Send scouting parties to explore the different biomes surrounding you, discover rare resources and bring them back to your village, opening up new possibilities.
Help us grow our community and get noticed on Steam by wishlisting the game and following us on social media. We now reached 20'000 wishlists! An additional skin for Onbu, the giant creature, will be unlocked for everyone.
After we came up with the concept for the game, we first started thinking about the general look and feel of the game’s world and how it would affect gameplay. We quickly settled on a blend of painted 2D backgrounds and static assets and hand-animated 2D characters in a 3D world, since it combined the strengths of our team members, was easy to navigate in-game and just looked really charming in our opinion.
Initial world sketch.

The creature, ‘Onbu’, was probably the most important part of the process as it is both the map where the game takes place and a character in itself. We started with concepts that were pretty close to existing animals, but moved away from this approach over time as we wanted something that you could more sensibly build a village on. Thus, the designs slowly but surely evolved into our very own earthen fantasy creature, the ‘Onbu’.
Concept art of Onbu.
Process sketches of Onbu.

Onbu wanders through a post-apocalyptic world, which was the next part of our art-design process. We wanted this world to be a stark contrast to Onbu to emphasize that it is toxic, wild and uninhabitable. Onbu on the other hand should feel like an island, an oasis, the only thing that makes survival possible for the humans building the settlement on its back.
Concept art of the world.
Various sketches of the world.

Speaking of the humans, the first step in designing them was figuring out their scale, not only to make sense gameplay-wise, but also to be visible enough at any zoom level. As for the design itself, our goal was to make them look friendly, maybe even cute, but also to have them reflect that the world they live in is a dangerous one, which is why we gave them protective clothing.
Villagers as they appear in-game.
Process sketches.

Next were the buildings, which had to look functional while conveying both the original culture of the villagers and their adaptations to living in their new environment. They are constructed from simple materials, and since Onbu’s back is so high up and winds are strong, many of them are powered by wind energy. Colorful flags can often be seen attached to them as they are used to communicate with other villagers.
Concept art of farming buildings.
Process sketches of various buildings.

Various other species besides humans have survived the apocalypse. Most of these creatures are a mix between something familiar, like mammals, and something that seems alien, like giant insects. With this approach, we hope to achieve a result somewhere in the middle, ideally something that is weird, but kinda cute.
First sketches of other creatures.
Inspiration
Our main inspirations for the game were the evocative drawings of french artist Moebius and the works of Studio Ghibli, specifically Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind and Princess Mononoke.

The World
Mysterious plants are spreading all over the world, turning the ground toxic and infertile and the air unbreathable. No one knows what caused this, but the source has to be somewhere out there, waiting to be discovered.
The Human Settlers
Increasingly polluted air and failing harvests caused by the spores have driven the humans from their village. Many have died from hunger and exposure until they crossed paths with the giant creature. The remaining few managed to climb onto its back and start a new settlement.
In order to sustain themselves, adapt to their environment and grow stronger and smarter, they’ll need to harvest materials from the creatures’ body and its surroundings, while also making sure that the creature itself survives and keeps on walking, away from the spores and, hopefully, towards a safer place.
The village on the back of the giant creature.

The Gigantic Creature, “Onbu”
Onbu is the name given to the creature by the villagers.
   Before the toxic spores started spreading, it was sleeping for hundreds of years, buried in the ground, looking like a mere hill. But when the soil around it became toxic, it awoke from its long slumber and started to walk, trying to find a safe spot where it can go to rest again.
   But it is neither used nor adapted to travelling long distances, having gotten its nutrients from the ground for such a long time.

   At first, it doesn’t even notice the small creatures crawling around on its back. But soon, they start interacting with it, sometimes hurting it, but also providing it with food and keeping up its strength.
   Maybe they are different from other parasites.
   Maybe they can survive this together.
Onbu, the giant creature.
The soundtrack is composed by NukeTan, an independent musician who has been composing for commercials and other games as a freelancer for years.
For the wandering village, he drew inspiration from various traditional folk music to bring the culture of the human settlers to life and immerse the player in the game’s world.
You can listen to a sample of the soundtrack below:



Games included:
Explorer: Empires of the Undergrowth | Niche | Wingspan
Architect: Rise to Ruins |  Judgment: Apocalypse Survival Simulation |  Endzone
Fawn Club Member: Niche | Nimbatus | Retimed | + PC key for all future Stray Fawn games
Alpinist: Airships | Devader | FAR | First Strike | Fishery | Kids | Morphies Law |  Niche | Nimbatus | Octahedron | Retimed | Slime-san | Transport Fever 2 | Towaga |  Unrailed

Add-ons
We are Stray Fawn Studio, an independent game studio based in Zurich, Switzerland, founded in 2016. So far, we have successfully kickstarted and shipped two simulation games: Niche - a genetics survival game and Nimbatus - The Space Drone Constructor. 
Our focus is on the development of PC games, but recently we started venturing into the console and mobile markets too.
We care very much about the personal development of our team members, trying our best to help each other grow, and our community, directly involving them in the development of our games.
Claudio Beck - Sound Design & Music
Denise Hohl - Graphic Design
Arno Justus - Game Design & Programming
Markus Rossé - Art & Animation
Philomena Schwab - Game Design & Marketing
David Stettler - Web Design
Micha Stettler - Programming
Stephanie Stutz - Art
Roger Winzeler -  Art


Why Kickstarter?
We funded our first two games via Kickstarter and it has not only provided us with a portion of the funds necessary to bring our ideas to fruition, but also with a community that is interested in the project from the start and accompanies us throughout the entire development process.
We believe that the close collaboration with our community has benefitted us, our games and our community, and we hope to once again reach people who want to bring this idea to life and go on this journey together with us.

Thank You!
Thank you so much for considering to support The Wandering Village. We can't wait to get to work and make this the best game it can be!
- Stray Fawn Studio
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since this is our third game on Kickstarter, we are fairly confident that we can deliver on our promises, as we did with our previous two campaigns.
However, game development can be unpredictable and delayed reward deliveries are always a risk. If the game feels unfinished, we prefer to continue working on it and delay its release until we are confident that you will enjoy the result.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Development update and shoutout for 'OddFauna : Secret of the TerraBeast'
updates.update_content:
Dear Onbu Riders
  Development is progressing nicely :D
The game is slowly but surely coming together!

updates.update_userinfo: Progress update - Award Nomination & New Video
updates.update_content:
Dear Onbu riders

We have just put together a little development overview of things we have been working on in the past months: https://imgur.com/t/creativity/ICgszFz

We also recently participated in the MIX showcase with a new video that gives some more insights on how we got the idea for The Wandering Village: https://youtu.be/Db4Ubwu0wPI

In other news, The Wandering Village has been nominated for 'Crowd-Funding Campaign Of 2020’ at the Indie Publishing Awards! Thank you all so much for making this possible :D


And finally, we sent out the survey at the end of February via Backerkit and 90% of you already answered, thank you! If you didn't receive a survey link, please check your spam folder or go to the following page and request the survey link by entering the email you used to back this campaign with.


Cheers & Thanks again,
Stray Fawn Studio

updates.update_userinfo: Backer survey & Community goal reached
updates.update_content:
Dear Onbu riders

First of all, sorry for the late update!
Our plan was to send it out once the backer survey is ready but we ran into some problem with the setup. Now, we’re finally good to go :)
You all should receive an email from BackerKit with your survey link today (or yesterday if you were part of the test group). Please check your inboxes!


First: You don’t need to create a BackerKit account to fill out your survey. When you receive the email with the survey, click the link to respond. Answer the questions about your reward preferences and provide shipping information if needed.

After you respond to your survey, you can go back later and change your responses at any time before we close the survey.
If you need to review your information or pledge status, you can return to your survey by clicking the link in your survey email or requesting your survey link under "Lost your survey?" on our BackerKit project page at
If you used your Facebook credentials to log in to your Kickstarter account, the BackerKit survey is sent to the email address you use for your Facebook account. If you have another email address that you prefer to use, please contact support at .

For this campaign we're unfortunately not able to provide add-ons via BackerKit. We're sorry about that. We're still evaluating if we can set up a merchandise store in the future. We'll inform you if we have news on that front.

For backers who have the Architect, Explorer, Alpinist or Fawn Club Member tier: Your Steam keys for these games should be sent to you via email shortly after the survey got sent out. This might take another 24h.


We managed to reach the social goals of the campaign! So everyone who pledged for a game key or higher will receive an additional copy of the game for free :)

Those of you who jumped onto our already have seen that we’ve been hard at work with the game’s development and we will soon share some of the progress we made via backer updates too!
We hope to release ‘The Wandering Village’ into Early Access in Q4 2021. This release will be on Steam.

And finally for today, we’d like to give a to , an adorable game about farming, breeding and battling blobs! It’s currently in its last hours on Kickstarter.

updates.update_userinfo: Last chance for a free additional copy of the game, Discord role, Dev-diaries
updates.update_content:
Dear Onbu riders,

We made it, we hit ALL the stretch goals :O
Thank you all so much for your support!

As a little thanks, we decided to go ahead and extend the deadline for the community goals by one month. So, we still have a chance to reach them.


If we hit one of the goals below, the social goals will count as reached.
(Every backer who pledged for a copy of the game or higher gets an additional copy of the game.)

Please help with these:
- 1050/1500
- 1550/2000 new

We also launched an campaign. So if you know anybody who missed the Kickstarter, some of the rewards are still available over there until December 18th!

Next steps:
We now started developing the game at full speed and will keep you updated on the progress! And we will be sending out the backer surveys for the reward delivery in the first half of next year prior to the early access launch.

Cheers & Thanks again,
Stray Fawn Studio

campaign.story:
Platform: PC  (Steam & DRM-Free)
Projected Release Date: Jan. 2023
 Trapped on a space station with a ruthless killer, Edward Locke must solve this mystery, or it will be his last. In this strange place, filled with even stranger people, Edward will discover more about himself than he ever could have imagined. Join Edward as he explores a hand-drawn richly conceived world, filled with danger, mystery, creativity, and memorable moments.
A Unique hand-drawn fully realized world: Companies, advertisements, locations, characters, and much more are being hand-crafted to breathe life into the world.
  Murder Mystery: Collect evidence, question suspects, explore the station, consult your murder board, and catch a killer.
 
Classic Adventure Mixed With Modern Ideas: Earn in-game currency for exploring the world and accomplishing tasks. Players can purchase cosmetics, accessories, and even an aquarium that can be filled with strange and otherworldly creatures.
  Blues Inspired Soundtrack: Mixing the emotionally charged music of cinema and the sheer style and heart of Blues, something fresh and bold is born.
 STRETCH GOALS:
15k Additional Chapter - Extended underwater exploration section of the game!
20k Extended Video Documentary - I will already be making some behind-the-scenes looks into the game but these additional funds will allow me to extend those looks into more of a proper Documentary.
30k Voice Actor - The title pretty much says it all, these additional funds will allow the hiring of Voice Actors to help bring life to the world.
40k ??? - Reaching the 30k Stretch Goal will unveil further Stretch Goals. 

Funds:
Funds raised from Kickstarter will go towards paying for living expenses and production costs. These funds will allow me to focus entirely on creating the best gaming experience I can.

Who is Edward Locke?
     Edward is a technical engineer who's just been assigned a new post by the Trowe Company. One would instantly notice the odd helmet Ed adorned. When Edward was a child, he had a rare degenerative lung disease. His Mother being the brilliant scientist she was created a headpiece and sleeping pod that help regulate the pressure in Ed's body. Ever since then, Edward has worn the helmet and slept in the pod, understanding that if he spends too much time apart from them, the separation will end in his demise.

What is Space Station 52?
      Space Station 52 was once a hot spot and a prominent tourist destination. The on-station lake stalked with some of the universe's most delicious seafood helped supply the local 5-Star restaurants. The Grand Millenium Hotel housed some of histories biggest stars and politicians. It's was a place to relax and enjoy some of the most luxurious things in life. Now it's little less than a chapter in the history books. Malnourished and crumbling, with many residents having moved on, the Space Station is nearing its finish.

Featured & Planned Locations:
Forbidden Island
Abandoned Lighthouse
Alien Fisherman's Wharf
Lake filled with strange creatures
Derelict Museum
Opulent Hotel
Seedy Tavern
Forgotten Alleys
Sci-fi Corridors
and even Space itself.
Story Intro:
     As Ed arrives at the Space Station, what he finds is a decaying beauty. He begins to interact with those odd few left on the station and discovers a melancholy and strangeness that seems to of tainted nearly everyone there.  No time is wasted putting him to task though, barely even having time to gather his things for his new living quarters, his sent on his way.
     While investigating a malfunctioning moisture recycler, Edward starts to have visions of things that simply can't be. Brushing it off as some version of jetlag, he presses on. As to the mystery of the broken recycler, his first clue is a pool of blood, his second, the mangled remains of the engineer he was sent to replace, logged in the machine. Perhaps overwhelmed by the sight of the body, Ed stumbles back, his mind rambling with visions. An encroaching blackness overcomes him, grasping for sanity, Ed falls to the ground.    

                    Darkness.

                   A pinhole of light interrupts the void.

                   The brilliant light grows.

                   Brighter.

                   Brighter.

                         Rudely welcomed by the fluorescent bulbs of the doctor's office, Edward is jolted awake. From here on, Edward finds himself in a world sometimes odd, sometimes beautiful, but always filled with deceit, mystery, and murder.

Social Goals:
 All social goals met = Unlock Alternate Costume for Main Character

The risk and challenge for this project is to acquire the funds needed to complete the game within a 2-year timeline. I already own all the resources needed to finish the game, it really comes down to time/money.

campaign.story:
Dirty Land is a videogame about real estate, crime, and desperation, inspired by classic sales movies of the 80s and 90s.  
Step into the shoes of Frank Marsh, a newly hired salesman for Pure Sky Properties, a real estate office where coffee is for closers and the status quo is hawking swamp land to unsuspecting buyers for a tidy profit. Will you cast aside your ethics for a quick buck, or will you take the high road and find a way to scrape by honestly? 
Platforms
We need your help to bring Dirty Land to Windows, OSX, and Linux.
Afterwards, we'd love to bring you this game to Nintendo Switch, to mobile devices, and to consoles like XBox and PlayStation; and we will if we can meet our funding goal, so let us know if you you'd like to see stretch goals for your favorite platform!
Something New Every Day 
Interesting events await outside of the strip mall
Welcome to your new job. At the start of every day, you begin out front of this unassuming, drab strip mall, where Pure Sky Properties is tucked away. Every day brings new characters to meet, new events to experience, and new stories to be told. What will it be tomorrow?
Choose a Lead, Go on a Sit, and Close 'em!
Two leads per day, choose wisely!
These are the new leads. You'll probably close one of your leads today, but can you close two leads a day? You're gonna need some caffeine for that. But you know what salesmen say about coffee... you better prove your worth if you want that cup of joe!
Every day you'll have chances to make a sale. Learn what they like, study their habits, memorize what you can about them, and get them to sign on the line which is dotted!
The Birth of a Salesman
The Story of Willy Loman... err... Frank Marsh
You are Frank Marsh. You've made a mistake that has ruined your family. You can't change your past, but you can change your future! 
Will you take the high road and stick to your principles, or take the low road and chase the easy money? Whichever path you take, you'll discover multiple endings based on the choices you've made and whether you succeed or fail in those choices.
On top of those choices, you'll need to balance your family life with your work life. Will you be a model father and go home and play with your kids? Or will you go out on another sit and close that elusive buyer? Go too far down one path and there will be consequences... your choice will change Frank's story - at work and at home.
Make Friends First, Sales Second
An office is a place where dreams come true. A place to meet lively new people. A sociopathic manager. An elusive owner. An opportunistic coworker out to steal your money. A flamboyant salesman with no concept of failure. A seductive hairdresser. An intrepid drycleaner. A neglected wife. A pair of dumb mob thugs. A ripped-off customer. A brutal detective. A homeless derelict with clues to a mystery. A rival firm across the street. And many more... 
Office manager Chet, possibly the most insane boss you'll ever have
This quirky drycleaner has some clues for you...
Grab a haircut and hear some gossip!
Earl will lend you money when you need it, but at a price...
Don't neglect your family!
Be Closing, Always
The money is out there. All you gotta do is reach out and grab it! How many leads can you pitch and sell? Can you bag the top leads? Will you take advantage of easy prey, or tackle deals with honor?
Just a sampling of leads you'll try and close
Play the Sleuth
Do I have your attention? Good. Because it's not just sales numbers that you need to keep your eye on.  You need to keep your wits about you, because in an office full of backstabbers, anything can and will happen. Including the surreal!
What a nice gesture from your boss!
Who killed Frank Junior?
Clearly you've been framed. But by who?
Solve Murder Mysteries
In a desperate world you'll meet desperate people. Dangerous people. People who will do anything to make rent. To not get fired. To make that promotion. To secure those juicy leads. From unsavory characters to hilarious charmers, they all have secret motives to uncover... you'll need to gather clues and piece together the truth to gain the upper hand in this double-crossing world! 
Suspects include: everyone
Nothing is as it seems in the dangerous world of real estate
Everyone is a suspect! Especially you! 
And this murder won't be the only one...
Rewards
Beyond the game itself, we're offering additional reward tiers:
Coffee Mug
Show everyone you're a closer with a signature Pure Sky Properties coffee mug.   
Limited Edition Coffee Mug. We want one too!
Become a Lead
Have your name in the game as one of the leads that Frank may encounter during his sales journey. So let me ask you this question: can you sell yourself?
All the salesmen are waiting for this new lead!
Note: we won't allow offensive names or story-breaking content in the game.
Leading Role
Immortalize yourself in the game by having your own portrait drawn in loving pixel glory! Not only will you be able to sell yourself in the game (you can send us personality traits to make you tougher to sell), you'll get a digital version to printout too! Ideal for either drivers licenses, passports, or to sit proudly framed on your office desk (your choice).  
Once you get your Pixel Portrait it will motivate you to keep your workstation very clean
Note: all reward images are mockups and may differ from the final version.
Credits and Acclaim
"The atmosphere is great... reinforcing the desperate, melancholy feel of the game. The grimy locations, ugly characters, and downbeat, jazzy soundtrack are reminiscent of a very particular kind of '90s movie, which is an aesthetic I've never seen captured by a videogame before. As for the game itself, my demo wasn't deep enough to say for sure, but I think the developer might be onto something special here. I hope it hits its funding target." - Andy Kelly, PC Gamer

Worried if we can do this or not? Here is a sampling of past reviews for Patchman vs Red. Circles, a videogame we made with the help of Kickstarter: 
Yes we can!
But... why? 
Why a videogame about real estate sales? Why not a fantasy game about dragons, elves, killing monsters, or World War 2? Well, those games already exist. This doesn't!  So we felt obliged to make it. We want a game chock full of surprise easter eggs from all the classic pop culture sales movies and shows. We want to capture the experience of working in a ridiculous sales office, without the commitment of actually having the job! Get a taste of what it's like, but more importantly, do and say the things you couldn't get away with in real life, like trash-talking your manager and fellow employees.
Development
We're using Godot Engine along with other development tools to build Dirty Land.
Developing the Office Interior
Coding in GDScript, a Python-like language
Developing Text Cards for our Trailer
An animated sprite in the Exterior Mall scene
We believe in Open Source, so we're using tools like Godot, Yarn, GIMP, Krita, Ubuntu, Audacity, regexxer, and more. We've also given back to the Godot community in the form of code, in repositories on github, including godot-yarn-importer and godot-calm-button, with more to come. 
We've been working on Dirty Land for two years in our free time.  Now we need to take it to the next level by finishing and launching so you can live the life of a salesman!
People
David Kerr - Coder, designer, writer, platform support, and more!  A jack-of-all-trades and master-of... how does that saying go?  Well, don't worry about it, because Dave never quits and never stops, gives it his all, and works so hard your back hurts!
Igor Motuz - Pixel-Artist whose color choices and drawing abilities combined with his dedication and persistence have turned our game from a pile of programmer art into a retro heaven!  We're lucky to have him along for the ride for this episode.  www.igormotuz.com
BENI.MARU - Musical maestro who crafted the jazzy instrumental for our trailer. He'll continue composing music for the rest of the game!  https://beni-o.com
Game Website
 http://www.dirtylandgame.com/
  Follow Us On
 Instagram | Twitter | Facebook 
Wishlist On Steam
Steam
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We currently have a great and functional proof-of-concept, and we've delivered on a crowdfunded game before. We are a talented team, a strong foundation, and have a unique concept and story to tell. 

The most challenging part of game development always seems to be delivering on time, but we're planning far into the future. To accommodate the risk, we've extended the delivery date beyond when we expect to complete. If we stay on track, backers will get their game sooner rather than later! If we go beyond that date, we promise to provide the game as developed to backers in the form of beta-builds, ahead of the game's full launch.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Sustainable Distribution
As a videogame, most of our rewards are digital. But for our physical bonus items, we will look for premium items, focusing on made in North America to reduce shipping distance.

campaign.story:
Demons Ate My Neighbors! is a retro-inspired twin-stick roguelite shooter developed by Tuned-Out Games that's bringing nostalgic cult arcade horror to PC and Nintendo Switch™ in 2021! 
Wishlist Demons Ate My Neighbors on Steam!
Check out GameSpot's preview here! 

Game Title: Demons Ate My Neighbors!
Platforms: PC, Switch (See Stretch Goals for XBX and PS5!)
Players: 1-2, Co-op
Game Type: Twin-stick shooter with roguelite elements
1991 - it seems like any other sweltering July in the sleepy suburbs of Fairweather Valley... Until a cursed VHS unleashes untold horrors upon the neighborhood, turns the residents evil, and generally makes April & Joey's summer a total bummer.  
Our heroes must exorcise their neighbors from hell, fight their way back to the haunted High School and rewind their summer to save the world!  
What happens when you mix the manic, scary, funny tone of Zombies Ate My Neighbors, with rogue-lite combat of Enter the Gungeon or The Binding of Isaac with of the funky co-op chaos of ToeJam & Earl?  You get DAMN! (Demons Ate My Neighbors!)  
Join April and Joey, two brave teens from 1991 wielding holy Splasha squirt guns to fight the "Modulation" that threatens Fairweather Valley.
 Entrusted with a high-tech device called the "RadWatch", you'll never get lost finding possessed citizens in our procedurally-generated levels. Spray, pray, & find the way - with the RadWatch. 
With the radical radar radio, you can find citizens, treasure and danger, and level it up by slaying monsters to boost its range and ability to find survivors - and hurry! The road to hell is paved with good intentions.
Two Heads Are Better than Dead! Team up in local co-op, then pump, refill, and spill 'em all with the Splasha squirt guns, loaded with an infinite supply of holy water. Pump past the limit with Overpump and unleash holy hydro hell. 
Swap & Pop nozzles to drench demons with different shots, effects and overblasts - then upgrade your Splasha's stats with Nitro Splashtanks found throughout the 'burbs of Fairweather. 
Weapons that aren't your Splasha are generally household items that range from m80s to soda cans, and may be lethal. Knock over mailboxes, trashcans and more to build our your arsenal with a variety of tricks to exploit monster weaknesses. 
Freeze Zombos with your nitrogen blaster, Zap Zaplings with electrical boxes, and Vaporize Vampunks with garlic pizza. 
Need something specific? Go visit Bob's!
Depending on your choices, some citizens will be Tuned-Out! and transform to climactic combat challenges where one of the three choices must be made: DAMN, DELIVER... OR DIE. 
You're in control of how to deal with bosses - You can choose to be kind and rewind by draining their recharging stamina with a Holy Hi-Fi arsenal to DELIVER them from evil, or blast through your problems with Lethal Lo-Fi weaponry to permanently DAMN them to HELL! 
Collect VHS tokens from Boss Demons to buy VHS Tapes from the state-of-the-art VHS VENDING MACHINE with new movies to inspire (and unlock) new permanent meta upgrades in the hideout.  
No two games are the same, as the game and world are living through both your progress and we have planned, free updates for the game post-launch.   Don't worry about death - with infinite timelines, another April & Joey are ready to DAMN! or Deliver all over again. 
Traverse through Fairweather Valley's most iconic locations as you battle your way to Fairweather Valley High School - using our patented Jim Boonie Land Plot System, each visit will feel funky fresh!
Fairweather Valley Mall - Let's Go Shopping!
Join The Watch, a generations old secret organization sworn to protect the town of Fairweather Valley. 
A posh 17-year old high-school senior-to-be, this “City Girl" reluctantly relocated to the boring 'Burbs, April longs for the excitement that used to be her life. A lover of music, her current jam is the bad-ass female RnB / Hip Hop Girl Group “DLC”. 
April is a leader when push-comes-to-shove, and her outside-the-box style and way of thinking makes her the outlier in a town of seemingly little substance.   
Joey is kinda a bad boy, tbh
The cool, collected, class clown - if he shows up to class. Joey comes from the wrong side-of-the-tracks and mixes with an infamous delinquent gang of misfits & greasers. 
This sophomore-to-be can bench 300 pounds, but underneath the layers of muscle and cheeseburgers lies a heart of gold.
He wants to become a famous rapper but is too embarrassed to perform in front of the boys.
Battle the citizens and Bosses of Fairweather Valley, choosing to either let them be DAMN'd or Deliver them from evil (depending on the lethality of your weapon).  
Some of Fairweather's citizens have been particularly affected by the Modulation, and stand in the way of your journey.  
They've been violently transformed into BOSS DEMONS - and you must use everything you've got to exorcise them and clear the way to absolution. 
Sheriff Pickens (and his trusty shotgun, Volkov)
You'd better believe there's gonna be an old school 3D filter you can turn on and off!
Ms. Kayla Gill, The Teacher From The Black Lagoon
 Jams to slay monsters to are imperative - and DAMN will feature a dynamic 80's and 90's inspired soundtrack brought to you by some legendary talent.  
Music by amazing artists like Tee Lopes, Varien, Nice Legs and Papoose - and maybe even a few more surprises... 
PLAY

 * Please note the physical edition is a retro-style case and map/manual, and does not include a physical disc. We are talking to some physical publishers, and will make sure all backers of this campaign are able to get first crack and future physical console editions.
Our mission at Tuned-Out Games is to give back to the gaming community; to connect fresh new talent from diverse backgrounds and provide a platform to collaborate on game development.
We aim to bring a funky, fresh perspective to classic gaming formulas and focus on positive experiences built on bringing people together.
With game industry experience spanning titles like 2064: Read Only Memories, ToeJam & Earl: Back in the Groove!, Sonic Mania, and companies like Razer and Red Bull Gaming, Tuned-Out Games has the chops to accomplish exactly that.
We also have some amazing advisors joining us from across the gaming and entertainment industry including Greg Johnson, (Creator of ToeJam & Earl ) and voice over work from luminaries such as Adam Harrington (The Wolf Among Us) and Macaulay Culkin (Ri¢hie Ri¢h).
PLAY

Demons Ate My Neighbors! launches in Fall 2021 on Nintendo Switch and PC in English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Japanese. 
Please visit Demons Ate My Neighbors!’ official website, join the Discord, and follow the game on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitch.
DROP IN, TURN UP, TUNE OUT!!
Thank you for joining The Watch and checking out our game Demons Ate My Neighbors!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating a functional video game that can be released within both the budget and the time constraints we have set is always subject to influences outside of our control.

We already have a functioning vertical slice of the game and are gaining substantial publisher interest. We are working within a conservative scope and with talented industry veterans so we believe we can achieve everything we have set out to do without over committing and also allowing for minor setback.

We believe that transparency is key and it is our mission to keep everyone who has backed our game informed of everything that is going on, both good and bad. Honesty isn’t just the best policy, it is the only policy.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The DAMN! Newsletter - Volume 1
Closing this Kickstarter - and relaunching one SOON! Thank you!
updates.update_content:
Thanks for believing!
As we've stated in previous updates, we wanted to leave the KS open for a while so we could get some great info and not abruptly cancel on you. To reiterate - some bad timing, big news stories, new opportunities, and new learnings have led us to relaunch our campaign soon. We're currently figuring out our strategy for launching the new Kickstarter - we're hoping to get one out in October - but after that, November and December aren't great months to launch - so we may move to January!

updates.update_userinfo: A few last updates before we officially wind down THIS Kickstarter in preparation for the NEXT!
updates.update_content:
Hello Watchers!
We've received wonderful feedback from the survey we've put out from both backers, non-backers, and from other sources - and we hear and are addressing a lot of your concerns loud and clear - but moreso, let us say how PUMPED we are to read about your mutual desire to see a game like this come about - and THANK you for all of the amazing praise.

updates.update_userinfo: Hello! We want to put out a survey for followers, Non-Backers!
updates.update_content:
Hey Watchers!
Thanks for coming along this journey with us or just keeping an eye on the project. A few days ago, we did an update for Backers only with a survey - and now we'd like to open up the same survey (but collected in a different pool) to the public. Click below.
https://forms.gle/cAcrnEzZL4XUECxM7

updates.update_userinfo: Watchers! Here's a DAMN cool survey - we want YOUR input on how to make this the best game & Kickstarter ever
updates.update_content:
Hello Watchers!
So continuing from our last post, there's a few reasons we've kept our KS page up for a bit longer while we wind down before shutting it down completely - and that's so we can give backers warning and ask you a few questions regarding the development of our game.
So we'll address a few things here -

updates.update_userinfo: Ending the Kickstarter campaign in the next couple days, but not before we get your opinions!
updates.update_content:
DAMN! looks like we got eclipsed by a bunch of (pretty awesome) gaming news stories on the first few days of our Kickstarter, which had a big effect on our trajectory and reach - and also served to teach us a few valuable lessons as well as provide great insight.

We want to thank everyone from the bottom of our hearts for their generosity and support in making Demons Ate My Neighbors a reality - and humbly ask for a little patience as we stop THIS current Kickstarter campaign shortly to focus on some major improvements.

But FEAR NOT! The dead don't die! The attention you helped bring us has unearthed some great opportunities - we'll be back, stronger than ever - with a new goal and stronger campaign with more fleshed out backer tiers - around late September / early October - this time, for all major systems, not just Switch & PC - but for PSN, XBOX, PC & Switch!!! And with better physical rewards for those of you who love to kick-it old school.

We've got a few other surprises and exciting things to share as well, so STAY TUNED!
We appreciate you all, and by the metrics of most Kickstarters, this was a smashing success with over $40,000 raised in just 3 days - so we would be honored if you continued your support for what will be an even more exciting product when we launch our NEW Kickstarter soon.
Follow @ on Twitter for the latest updates.

After all, games, especially roguelites - are about falling and starting over again, with more skill and knowledge than you had before. Totally on-brand.

We shall rise again in a few short weeks time, enough to make for a spooktacular October... until then, loyal Watchers - Drop in, Turn Up and TUNE OUT!!
We hope to see you soon!

Stay pumped.

- Kian Matthew Naderi
(Director, Demons Ate My Neighbors)

updates.update_userinfo: Demons Ate My Neighbors will rise again! 🙏 A NEW Kickstarter appears?
updates.update_content:
Today’s topic is the OverPump mechanic on your Splasha and your pressure gauge.
As we mentioned yesterday, when you spray water from your Splasha, your water pressure goes down. While it does recover automatically, its a slow process, and pumping with Left Trigger helps you get back to full splashing sooner than later.
When your Splasha gets too full, as in, you pump beyond the pressure capacity, you can load an OverPump Blast. This is a valuable tool for getting past big crowds, and most types of OverPump have either a wide range of attack, a powerful direct attack, or a big pushback effect.

updates.update_userinfo: Pump It Up! Your Guide To Your Splasha’s Pressure Gauge
updates.update_content: Today’s topic is your main weapon and trusted ally: The Splasha.

campaign.story:
Wishlist us now on Steam!
Mad Mimic is an indie game developer based in Brazil, that has been making games since 2017. In 2017, we successfully launched No Heroes Here across multiple platforms and we were selected as one of the winners of the PAX10 independent game showcase. Currently, we are working on our third title known as Dandy Ace!
Coming from a variety of backgrounds, the people on our team have in common both their love for video games as well as having strong commitment to designing and developing games that are more than a product, they are games that contribute to the medium, games that make us proud.
Experienced in designing content for many different genres, many of our teammates are graduates from the famous Vancouver Film School, including one of our founders, with skills we can put to the test in our projects in order to deliver the best of their know-how and talent.
We've learned a lot from the development and launch of No Heroes Here and Monica e a Guarda dos Coelhos and it has helped in the development of our third title, Dandy Ace.
As with every project, setbacks may occur and we will work hard to prevent and avoid delays or minimize them as much as possible. We don't expect delays with the production of the rewards and physical goods. So far, we are on track and very proud of the goals accomplished!
We want to add some extras to the game, and we can only do that with this Kickstarter and its stretch goals. We are 200% committed to the project and have enjoyed the development process as much as we hope you enjoy the game once it is in your hands. We've been working on Dandy Ace by ourselves up until now, fully devoting our time and effort into this project. While a majority of core game concepts we had envisioned for the project have come to fruition, there are still many things we would like to do prior to the full release of the game. This is where we need your help. Crowdfunding provides us with several opportunities to directly reach new players and engage our community, not only through funding but through feedback and ideas as well. We'll be inviting backers to test development builds and communicate with our team leading up to launch.
There are two primary things we hope to accomplish with our Kickstarter campaign. First, we would like to avoid possible Early Access and continue to improve and add features within Dandy Ace to confidently launch the title fully across each platform once it is ready. The second goal of the Kickstarter is to bring more awareness to the game and reach new potential players. We've grown an amazing supportive community of players around Dandy Ace's development so far and hope to continue to do so on a larger scale. A Kickstarter campaign also allows for our community and backers to become more involved in the development process leading up to launch while also supporting our efforts directly.
 Dandy Ace is an over the top roguelike experience that follows a fabulous magician seeking to combine and use his magical cards while fighting and looting his way to defeat the Green-Eyed Illusionist, Lele, who has imprisoned him in a cursed mirror.
Play as Dandy Ace, the amazing hero, and survive the challenges of the extravagant, lavish and ever changing palace created to defeat him filled with bizarre creatures and outrageous bosses. Find all of the magical cards, gather shards and gold, and get help from his assistants and unconventional allies.
 Dandy Ace will be coming to PC, Playstation, Xbox, and Switch. The initial launch will be for PC with the consoles to follow in the months after.
Story
Lele, also known as the Green-Eyed Illusionist, always dreamed of becoming the world's greatest magician. However, he was never able to be taken seriously due to his lack of skill and his tacky appearance. At his lowest point, Lele witnessed the rise of a brilliant prodigy magician named Dandy Ace. The conflict between admiration and envy soon became an obsession, as he decided to try to get rid of the talented young magician. Lele exchanged his soul in order to use the spell of the Cursed Mirror to trap Ace inside of it forever.
Inside the Cursed Mirror, Lele became the king. He created a bizarre palace, filled with trials and creatures, with the goal of humiliating Ace. Due to Lele's desire to watch the young magician fail repeatedly, every time Ace is defeated, he is forced back to the beginning. In order to escape and break the curse, Dandy Ace has to use all of his magic cards and incredible performances to defeat the different enemies found within the Cursed Mirror and take down Lele.
Dandy Ace vs Boss Axolangelo, the Master Painter
Try, die and try again until you beat the Green-Eyed Illusionist with the replayability and adrenaline of a rogue-like but with permanent upgrades that make you stronger as you continue to reach new levels and progress further with each run!
2D isometric fast-paced action with lots of challenging but fair combat engagements. Battle your way through bizarre creatures and outrageous bosses while building up your own arsenal of magic.
 The Magical Cards 
Dandy Ace’s core mechanic revolves around the Magical Cards which act as skills in the game. Players are able to create countless combinations of skills, upgrades, and play styles by combining the different cards they come across on each run.
Every Magical Card has a default skill associated with it. These skills can be upgraded further by combining another Magical Card with it. Players can find stronger versions of cards as they progress through the levels and experiment with the different skills. Players are not guaranteed the same cards each run so it will be important to learn them all!
The cards fall into 3 main categories: Blue, Pink, and Yellow
Movement skill cards are divided between two types: Dashes and Blinks.
These cards are often divided into Melee and Ranged Skills.
These cards have the widest variety of mechanics, from giant barriers & personal shields to giant slow fields!
Dandy Ace
The game's protagonist is none other than one of the greatest magicians alive, the dashing Dandy Ace. Ace is a rising star full of confidence and extremely charismatic. Even in defeat, Ace's confidence remains unshaken in his quest to defeat Lele, the Green-Eyed Illusionist, and escape from the cursed mirror.
 Lele, the Green-Eyed Illusionist 
Lele is the main antagonist of Dandy Ace. A magician himself, Lele both admires and hates Ace. As his obsession with Ace grew and his own popularity dropped, Lele sold his soul and trapped Ace inside of the Cursed Mirror.
Enemies
The enemies found within the Cursed Mirror are bizarre creations from Lele's imagination with the only purpose of denying Ace's escape. Ace will also run into some of Lele's prestigious palace guests and unique bosses as he progresses through the various stages providing players with more challenging encounters. Here you can find a few of them!
 Bunny Butler & Bunny Jester 
The Bunny Butler & Bunny Jester are the most common and basic enemies Dandy Ace will encounter. The Bunny Butler is a melee based enemy looking to charge at Ace whereas the Bunny Jester attacks from range.
Cuckoo Nightmare
 The Cuckoo Nightmare is a tankier enemy Ace must face fairly early on with a wide range of attacks for both up close encounters and at range.
Turrets & Totems
Stationary enemies that fire projectiles towards Dandy Ace. There are several different types of Turrets that Ace will encounter including Homing Turrets, Poison Turrets, and Multi-Shot Turrets.
Similar to Turrets, Totems are static enemies. These enemies do not attack Ace though, they provide Auras around them buffing other enemy creatures and creating more unique combat scenarios. These were created by Lele as bizarre furniture items decorating the Cursed Mirror realm.
Oozes
These slime-like creatures split off into multiple smaller versions of themselves during combat forcing Ace to deal with multiple Oozes at once when visiting the Garden.
Lady Fan & Lady Hook
These are Lele’s palace guests and some of the strongest enemies encountered in the Cursed Mirror. Lady Fan is the first humanoid enemy Ace comes across and she isn't to be underestimated. Lady Hook is a more challenging version of this enemy and another humanoid that is able to use her hook projectile to pull Ace.
Bosses
Besides Lele, there are several different complex bosses Ace will need to defeat to escape the Cursed Mirror. Each boss has unique mechanics that will test Dandy Ace and prepare him for the fight against Lele, The Green-Eyed Illusionist!
Axolangelo, The Master of Arts
The Art Gallery is where Axolangelo resides alongside all of his paintings. The name Axolangelo was due to an internal pun/joke within the development team that came from combining the animal axolotl and the famous painter Michelangelo. This is one of the first major challenges and bosses Ace will encounter in the Palace. Players can attempt to take him on in our free demo available now on the Dandy Ace Steam page!
Allies
Dandy Ace was not the only one to be trapped in the Cursed Mirror by Lele. Ace will need the help of his stage assistants and some of the other characters he meets along the way to escape.
Jolly Jolly & Jenny Jenny
Ace’s twin stage assistants will be there to help Ace investigate the power of the shards in the Cursed Mirror realm as well as take care of the many magical cards and trinkets Ace collects.
Nnif
Nnif is a bunny that used to work for Lele but decided to end his services and pursue a rogue life as a smuggler. Nnif is always looking to sell you the latest exclusive power-ups at his Tent in exchange for shards.
The Art of Dandy Ace
 We want to give you a game as spectacular as Dandy Ace himself!This is just a sample of our work, with character designs, concepts, illustrations, and background pictures that you will see in the final product.
Dandy Ace concept art
Gatekeeper Boss early exploration
Lele in-game version concept art
Environment General props concept art
Environment Garden props concept art
Dandy Ace Key Illustration

 Rewards
Dandy Ace (digital)
You’ll receive a digital copy of Dandy Ace for your Steam Account!
Beta Access
Get Beta access to the game in Steam! This will be an earlier, in-progress version of the game that you can experience before everyone else. You can play it by November 2020 with the Tier 2 or even earlier in October 2020 with the Tier 4!
Help us test the game, provide feedback, and get a sneak peek!                        
Your Name in the Credits
We appreciate your support, so we'll put your name in the game!
Dandy Ace Artbook (digital)
Full-color digital art book featuring concept sketches, characters artworks, in-game art assets, illustrations, comics and a lot more!
Dandy Ace Soundtrack (digital)
Enjoy the whole original soundtrack of Dandy Ace composed by Roberto Kramer. 
Deck of Cards (physical)
 You’ll receive a physical copy of a Dandy Ace Deck of Cards! 
 No Heroes Here (digital)
You’ll receive a digital copy of 'No Heroes Here' for your Steam Account! You can learn more about our previous game here!
 You help us to design something! 
That's exactly what you read! You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with our team to design either a new Skin for Ace, or an Enemy, or even a Boss depending on the reward tier.
We have limited tiers with special rewards. Keep checking our Kickstarter page so you can be the first to know all the surprises we are getting ready for our backers!
 Support Us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've learned a lot from our experience of working on and launching No Heroes Here and hope to improve on that with Dandy Ace. Dandy Ace is a larger project for us and while we are confident that we will be able to launch the game across all platforms next year, there are many features that we'd like to get in for launch that are still incomplete or haven't had development started on them. There are also existing features that need improvement such as the tutorials and overall Narrative experience.

We hope to get as much of it done as possible for the launch or shortly after launch. Some things may change or take longer than expected in the development process but we will be keeping our community and all backers informed about all updates, issues, and changes on a regular basis. Thank you for all your support and faith in our project and team!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Slay an Ooze (and pledge manager access)
support.descp:
This and all other pledges will get you access to the pledge manager, which we will keep open for as long as we can. See the "Pledge Manager" section for details.
In addition, for everyone who pledges $1 or adds $1 to their pledge, I will slay an ooze in their name. See the "Let's Kill Oozes" section for details.

support.title: Retailer Pledge
support.descp: THIS PLEDGE IS ONLY FOR BRICK AND MORTAR RETAIL STORES. This is a deposit which gives you access to a separate pledge manager with reduced prices that will be open for longer. See the "Retailers" section for details. If you pledge this tier and we are unable to verify you as a retailer, the deposit will not be refunded.

support.title: Frosthaven
support.descp:
This gets you the main Frosthaven box and all the goodness inside.
Shipping is not included in this price. See the "Shipping" section for details.

support.title: Frosthaven Bundle
support.descp:
This gets you the main Frosthaven box, plus the Frosthaven Solo Scenarios, the Frosthaven Removable Stickers, and the Forteller Narration to enhance your experience. See the "Pledge Tiers" section for details.
Shipping is not included in this price. See the "Shipping" section for details.

support.title: Frosthaven Bundle + Organizer and Coins
support.descp:
This gets you everything from the previous tier, plus the Frosthaven Organizer from Broken Token and a set of 60 metal coins to enhance your experience even further. See the "Pledge Tiers" section for details.
Shipping is not included in this price. See the "Shipping" section for details.

support.title: Game Play All-In Bundle
support.descp:
This gets you all the game play elements for the entire series: Gloomhaven, Forgotten Circles, Frosthaven, both solo scenario sets, all three removable sticker sets, and the Frosthaven Forteller narration to enhance your experience. See the "Pledge Tiers" section for details.
Like all pledge levels, shipping and taxes are not included in this price. See the "Shipping" and "Taxes & VAT" sections for details.

Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Your name in the credits under "Backer"

support.title: Soundtrack, Art Book + Exclusive Skins
support.descp:
Receive the game and soundtrack in addition to a digital artbook showcasing Necrofugitive's concept art, level design, and sprites with artist commentary! You also receive a pack of in-game skins exclusive to Kickstarter backers in this tier or higher!

Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Digital Art Book
Exclusive Kickstarter character skins
Your name in the credits under "Backer"

support.title: Alpha Tester
support.descp:
Receive early builds of the game long before anybody else! You will be invited to a private Discord channel and will become part of a group that will be a vital resource for feedback and the fine tuning of gameplay!
INCLUDES:
Digital copy of Necrofugitive on Steam, Switch or PS4
Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Digital Art Book
Exclusive Kickstarter character skins
Early builds of the game
Your name in the credits under "Alpha Tester"
Access to the private Discord Alpha Channel

support.title: Design a Perk
support.descp:
Work with us to design a purchasable upgrade in the skill tree! You will be involved in game design of the perk's function and intended use! (All designs decisions are subject to our approval!)
INCLUDES:
Digital copy of Necrofugitive on Steam, Switch or PS4
Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Digital Art Book
Exclusive Kickstarter character skins
Early builds of the game
Your name in the credits under "Alpha Tester"
Access to the private Discord Alpha Channel

support.title: Design a special ability
support.descp:
Help us develop a concept for a unlockable special ability for the skill tree! Want to shoot tendrils out of your face? Teleport across rifts in space? You will be involved in designing any special ability you can think of and you will also play a part in animation design and game design! (All design decisions are subject to our approval!)
INCLUDES:
Digital copy of Necrofugitive on Steam, Switch or PS4
Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Digital Art Book
Exclusive Kickstarter character skins
Early builds of the game
Access to the private Discord Alpha Channel
Your name in the credits under "Alpha Tester"

support.title: Design a Minion OR Enemy
support.descp:
Help us design a concept of a fully animated enemy (or summonable ally) with a complete moveset! A ruthless knight that uses a flail to smash demon skulls into a bloody pulp? A demon minion that vomits swarm underlings? It's all up to you! (All design decisions are subject to our approval!)
INCLUDES:
Digital copy of Necrofugitive on Steam, Switch or PS4
Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Digital Art Book
Exclusive Kickstarter character skins
Early builds of the game
Your name in the credits under "Alpha Tester"
Access to the private Discord Alpha Channel

support.title: Design a Level
support.descp:
Work with us to develop an environment concept of an entire level! This includes setting, assets, props, weather, and every tiny artistic detail you could imagine. Anything from scarred battlefields to collapsed dungeons! You will also be involved backstory writing for your designed level! (All design decisions are subject to our approval)
INCLUDES:
Digital copy of Necrofugitive on Steam, Switch or PS4
Digital copy of Necrofugitive's soundtrack by Edwin Montgomery
Digital Art Book
Exclusive Kickstarter character skins
Early builds of the game
Access to the private Discord Alpha Channel
Your name in the credits under "Alpha Tester"

support.title: Support the Muffin!
support.descp: You'll get a warm fuzzy feeling inside, as well as regular updates on the campaign.

support.title: The Original One
support.descp:
You’ll get a copy of Muffin Time, wrapped up in a terrifying little cube.
– 2-6 players
– Contains 120 cards

support.title: The Kickstarter One
support.descp:
You’ll get a copy of Muffin Time, along with all sorts of wonderful stretch goals we uncover along the way.
- 2-6 players
- Contains 120 cards
- Includes all applicable stretch goals

support.title: The Bigger Kickstarter One
support.descp:
Ooh boy. You’ll get a copy of Muffin Time, all sorts of stretch goals, and a copy of The Rainbow Pack – featuring 40 cards not found in the main game.
- 2-8 players
- Contains 160 cards
- Includes all applicable stretch goals

support.title: The Bestest Kickstarter One
support.descp:
Hold onto your hats. You’ll get a copy of Muffin Time, all of the stretch goals, a copy of The Rainbow Pack AND a copy of The Pie Flavour Pack – that’s 80 extra cards!
- 2-10 players
- Contains 200 cards
- Includes all stretch goals

support.title: International Bestest Kickstarter One
support.descp:
Exactly the same as the £30 Bestest Kickstarter tier, just with reduced international shipping! Includes a copy of Muffin Time, all the stretch goals, a copy of The Rainbow Pack and a copy of The Pie Flavour Pack.
- 2-10 players
- Contains 200 cards
- Includes all stretch goals

support.title: The Bestest Friend Kickstarter Package
support.descp:
Treat a special someone to a card game about Muffins. This is like backing the £30 option twice, except you'll only pay £2 extra for delivery charge.
- 2 x Muffin Time
- 2 x Rainbow Pack
- 2 x Pie Flavour Pack
- 2 x Stretch goal rewards

support.title: The Bestest Buddy’s Kickstarter Package
support.descp:
Spread the love even further with four copies of Muffin Time. With this tier, you’ll receive four copies of the game, with all the lovely trimmings.
4 x Muffin Time
4 x Rainbow Pack
4 x Pie Flavour Pack
4 x Stretch goal rewards

support.title: GEM DESIGNER
support.descp:
Design a GEM for Roguebook!
Gems allow you to upgrade socketed cards to provide them with powers they normally would never have.
These powerful stones have a wide range of effects, and allow an infinite amount of possibilities when customizing your deck.
Have a gem idea you'd like to see appear in-game? You'll work with our game designers to make it a thing.
This design pledge is the highest due to the fact that gems can have such a significant impact on the balance of the game. We'll work closely with you to make sure the end result is something really special.

Dive fully into the world of Omno with the digital deluxe edition including the downloadable atmospheric soundtrack and a beautiful digital art book with more than 20 pages packed with concept art, style development images and in-depth explanations about the visuals.
INCLUDES:
Hearty thank you from the dev
Digital wallpaper pack
Your name in the credits as "Supporter"
Access to backer Discord channel
Digital copy of the game
Art Book (digital)
Soundtrack (digital)

support.title: Socializer: Companion+Additional key
support.descp:
Your companion will have a unique glowing, sparkling Kickstarter-skin (you can switch to the default skin if you want to).

Your friend has no credit card? Or you want to make a gift? Receive a second Steam-Key of OMNO - only on this tier.
INCLUDES:
Hearty thank you from the dev
Digital wallpaper pack
Your name in the credits as "Supporter"

Digital copy of the game
